'''George Boxley''' (1780–1865) was an American abolitionist and former slaveholder who allegedly tried to coordinate a rebellion of enslaved people on March 6, 1815, while living in [[Spotsylvania County, Virginia|Spotsylvania, Virginia]]. His plan was based on "heaven-sent" orders to free slaved people. He tried to recruit enslaved people from Orange, Spotsylvania, and Louisa counties to meet at his home with horses, guns, swords and clubs. He planned to attack and take over [[Fredericksburg, Virginia|Fredericksburg]] and [[Richmond, Virginia]].<ref name="historypoint">[http://www.historypoint.org/af_am_people_places.asp Virginia Johnson, "African American History in the Rappahannock Region"], History Point.org, accessed April 12, 2009</ref> Lucy, an enslaved woman, informed her owner, and the plot was foiled. Six enslaved people allegedly involved were imprisoned or executed. With his wife's help, Boxley escaped from the Spotsylvania County Jail and, despite a reward, he was never caught.
'''George Boxley''' (1780–1865) was an American abolitionist and former slaveholder who allegedly tried to coordinate a rebellion of enslaved people on March 6, 1815, while living in [[Spotsylvania County, Virginia|Spotsylvania, Virginia]]. His plan was based on "heaven-sent" orders to free slaved people. He tried to recruit enslaved people from Orange, Spotsylvania, and Louisa counties to meet at his home with horses, guns, swords and clubs. He planned to attack and take over [[Fredericksburg, Virginia|Fredericksburg]] and [[Richmond, Virginia]].<ref name="historypoint">[http://www.historypoint.org/af_am_people_places.asp Virginia Johnson, "African American History in the Rappahannock Region"], History Point.org, accessed April 12, 2009</ref> Lucy, an enslaved woman, informed her owner, and the plot was foiled. Five slaves were executed for their involvement in the plot and another six were sentenced to [[Penal transportation|transportation]]. With his wife's help, Boxley escaped from the Spotsylvania County Jail and, despite a reward, he was never caught.


Boxley fled to [[Ohio]] and [[Indiana]], where he was joined by his family. He built a cabin in 1830, the first in Adams Township. He helped escapees, taught school, and supported [[Abolitionism in the United States|abolitionism]].<ref name="historypoint" /><ref>[https://www.h-net.org/reviews/showrev.cgi?path=225481004388545 James C. Foley, "Migrants against Slavery in Black and White"], review of Philip J. Schwarz, ''Migrants Against Slavery: Virginians and the Nation''], History.net</ref> The [[George Boxley Cabin]] has been listed on the [[National Register of Historic Places]].<ref>[http://www.sheridanhistoricalsociety.com/Sheridan/news/nr070815.html "Boxley Cabin Area Will Be Archaeological Focus On Sept. 15"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080518113736/http://www.sheridanhistoricalsociety.com/Sheridan/news/nr070815.html |date=May 18, 2008 }}, Sheridan Historical Society, August 15, 2007, accessed April 13, 2009</ref>

== Early life and education ==
Jacob grew up on a farm on the [[Laredo, Texas|Rio Grandenear, Laredo, Texas]], which at the time was the poorest city in the United States.<ref>{{Cite book |last=Affairs |first=United States Congress House Committee on Foreign Affairs Subcommittee on Inter-American |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=3hujxwEACAAJ |title=International Bridge Act of 1971: Hearing, Ninety-second Congress, First Session, on H.R. 6274 ... September 16, 1971 |date=1971 |publisher=U.S. Government Printing Office |language=en}}</ref> His father was German-American and his mother was Mexican-American.<ref>{{Cite news |title=Full Context Interview with Jacob G. Hornberger – The Future of Freedom Foundation |url=https://www.fff.org/explore-freedom/article/full-context-interview-with-jacob-g-hornberger/ |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20250403072120/https://www.fff.org/explore-freedom/article/full-context-interview-with-jacob-g-hornberger/ |archive-date=2025-04-03 |access-date=2026-02-07 |work=The Future of Freedom Foundation |language=en-US}}</ref>

Hornberger received a [[bachelor's degree]] in [[economics]] from the [[Virginia Military Institute|Virginia]] [[Virginia Military Institute|Military Institute]], and a [[Juris Doctor Degree|Juris Doctor degree]] from the [[University of Texas at Austin|University]] [[University of Texas at Austin|of Texas]].<ref name=":2" />

Notability concerns - sourcing does not establish WP:GNG

← Previous revision Revision as of 00:00, 8 February 2026
Line 28: Line 28:
::'''AnimeCons.com:''' The fact that a source is widely used across anime convention articles doesn't make it reliable under [[WP:RS]]. A site operator verifying information against official convention websites makes it a '''curated directory''', not independent editorial coverage. [[WP:GNG]] requires "significant coverage in reliable sources that are independent of the subject." AnimeCons.com entries are not ''about'' Tora-Con in any analytical or editorial sense; they are listings ''of'' Tora-Con's event data. The same way we wouldn't cite an IMDB page to establish notability of a film, we shouldn't cite a convention directory to establish notability of a convention. If there's a broader consensus that AnimeCons.com is reliable, that would be worth establishing at [[WP:RSN]], but widespread use is not the same as community endorsement.
::'''AnimeCons.com:''' The fact that a source is widely used across anime convention articles doesn't make it reliable under [[WP:RS]]. A site operator verifying information against official convention websites makes it a '''curated directory''', not independent editorial coverage. [[WP:GNG]] requires "significant coverage in reliable sources that are independent of the subject." AnimeCons.com entries are not ''about'' Tora-Con in any analytical or editorial sense; they are listings ''of'' Tora-Con's event data. The same way we wouldn't cite an IMDB page to establish notability of a film, we shouldn't cite a convention directory to establish notability of a convention. If there's a broader consensus that AnimeCons.com is reliable, that would be worth establishing at [[WP:RSN]], but widespread use is not the same as community endorsement.
::'''Founding date:''' I agree this is a minor point. My mention of it was in the interest of article accuracy, not as an argument for or against deletion.
::'''Founding date:''' I agree this is a minor point. My mention of it was in the interest of article accuracy, not as an argument for or against deletion.
::'''Reporter Magazine:''' I did not dispute Reporter's independence — note that I listed it among the legitimate independent sources. My position has consistently been that the independent local media coverage (WHAM, WHEC, Time Warner Cable News, Reporter, RIT News) is where the article's sourcing strength lies, and that the AnimeCons.com directory listings and the event history table built on them do not add to that strength.

::'''AfD process:''' As an IP editor, I cannot create AfD subpages, so I posted a request at [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion]] for an autoconfirmed editor to complete the listing. If you feel the article clearly meets [[WP:GNG]], you're welcome to participate there when the AfD formally starts, or to complete the listing yourself so the discussion can proceed properly. Either way, the sourcing concerns I've raised here apply independently of the AfD and I raised them here so they could be discussed on their merits. ← Previous revision Revision as of 00:00, 8 February 2026
Line 187: Line 187:
For the first time, all four semi-finalists at a professional ranking snooker tournament were from mainland China.<ref name="BBC_allChina" /> England and Scotland were the only previous countries to have produced all four semi-finalists at a ranking event.<ref name="WST_allChina" /> In the first semi-final, which lasted almost four and a half hours, Zhang faced Zhou. In a closely fought match, the players were never separated by more than one frame, as Zhang came from behind three times to tie the scores at 4{{nbnd}}4. Zhang then made a century of 121 to lead 5{{nbnd}}4, but Zhou made an 82 break to tie the scores at 5{{nbnd}}5. In the decider, Zhang missed the last red while playing the shot with the {{Cuegloss|rest}}. Zhou cleared to the {{Cuegloss|brown ball|brown}} but failed to get position on the {{Cuegloss|blue ball|blue}}, which would have been {{Cuegloss|match ball}}. During a {{Cuegloss|safety}} exchange, Zhou went {{Cuegloss|in-off}} the blue, and Zhang potted the last three balls, winning the match on the last black. Defeat for Zhou meant that he was still seeking his maiden ranking title, having lost five ranking semi-finals and four ranking finals. "I was nervous in the last frame and I'm still nervous here," Zhang said in his post-match interview, noting that his hands were still shaking. "I don't know why I'm playing so well this week. Maybe just because my family are here. They give me more confidence and I love Hong Kong. I can speak Cantonese here so it is like a second home."<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=7 February 2026 |title=Zhang triumphs in black ball thriller |url=https://www.wst.tv/news/2026/february/07/zhang-triumphs-in-black-ball-thriller/ |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[World Snooker Tour]] |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Nelson |first=Craig |date=7 February 2026 |title=World Grand Prix: Zhao Xintong and Zhang Anda to meet in all-Chinese final |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/snooker/articles/c5y2yq15lz0o |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[BBC Sport]] |language=en-GB}}</ref>
For the first time, all four semi-finalists at a professional ranking snooker tournament were from mainland China.<ref name="BBC_allChina" /> England and Scotland were the only previous countries to have produced all four semi-finalists at a ranking event.<ref name="WST_allChina" /> In the first semi-final, which lasted almost four and a half hours, Zhang faced Zhou. In a closely fought match, the players were never separated by more than one frame, as Zhang came from behind three times to tie the scores at 4{{nbnd}}4. Zhang then made a century of 121 to lead 5{{nbnd}}4, but Zhou made an 82 break to tie the scores at 5{{nbnd}}5. In the decider, Zhang missed the last red while playing the shot with the {{Cuegloss|rest}}. Zhou cleared to the {{Cuegloss|brown ball|brown}} but failed to get position on the {{Cuegloss|blue ball|blue}}, which would have been {{Cuegloss|match ball}}. During a {{Cuegloss|safety}} exchange, Zhou went {{Cuegloss|in-off}} the blue, and Zhang potted the last three balls, winning the match on the last black. Defeat for Zhou meant that he was still seeking his maiden ranking title, having lost five ranking semi-finals and four ranking finals. "I was nervous in the last frame and I'm still nervous here," Zhang said in his post-match interview, noting that his hands were still shaking. "I don't know why I'm playing so well this week. Maybe just because my family are here. They give me more confidence and I love Hong Kong. I can speak Cantonese here so it is like a second home."<ref name=":0">{{Cite web |date=7 February 2026 |title=Zhang triumphs in black ball thriller |url=https://www.wst.tv/news/2026/february/07/zhang-triumphs-in-black-ball-thriller/ |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[World Snooker Tour]] |language=en}}</ref><ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Nelson |first=Craig |date=7 February 2026 |title=World Grand Prix: Zhao Xintong and Zhang Anda to meet in all-Chinese final |url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/snooker/articles/c5y2yq15lz0o |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[BBC Sport]] |language=en-GB}}</ref>


In the second semi-final, Zhao led Xiao by 56 points in the opener, but Xiao produced a 65 clearance to win the frame on the last black. Zhao made breaks of 55 and 69 to win the next two frames, but Xiao tied the scores at 2{{nbnd}}2 at the mid-session interval. Zhao then won three consecutive frames to lead 5–2. Xiao won frame eight, but Zhao made a century of 121 in frame nine to complete a 6–3 victory. "I played much better today than yesterday," said Zhao after the match. "I made some good adjustments in all aspects. I was able to stay within my own rhythm. As a result, my overall performance was quite good." Anticipating the final against Zhang, he commented: "I hope the fans will continue to support me. Especially yesterday, I could really feel the atmosphere and support from the audience and that was a huge help to me... I lost to [Zhang] not long ago, so tomorrow I will definitely give it my best." In addition to reaching the final of the event, both Zhang and Zhao ensured that they would finish within the top 16 on the one-year ranking list after the event and qualify for the 2026 Players Championship.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2">{{Cite web |date=7 February 2026 |title=Zhao makes Hong Kong final |url=https://www.wst.tv/news/2026/february/07/zhao-makes-hong-kong-final/ |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[World Snooker Tour]] |language=en}}</ref>
In the second semi-final, Zhao led Xiao by 56 points in the opener, but Xiao produced a 65 clearance to win the frame on the last black. Zhao made breaks of 55 and 69 to win the next two frames, but Xiao tied the scores at 2{{nbnd}}2 at the mid-session interval. Zhao then won three consecutive frames to lead 5–2. Xiao won frame eight, but Zhao made a century of 121 in frame nine to complete a 6–3 victory. "I played much better today than yesterday," said Zhao after the match. "I made some good adjustments in all aspects. I was able to stay within my own rhythm. As a result, my overall performance was quite good." Anticipating the final against Zhang, he commented: "I hope the fans will continue to support me. Especially yesterday, I could really feel the atmosphere and support from the audience and that was a huge help to me... I lost to [Zhang] not long ago, so tomorrow I will definitely give it my best." By reaching the final, both Zhang and Zhao ensured that they would finish within the top 16 on the one-year ranking list after the event and qualify for the 2026 Players Championship.<ref name=":1" /><ref name=":2">{{Cite web |date=7 February 2026 |title=Zhao makes Hong Kong final |url=https://www.wst.tv/news/2026/february/07/zhao-makes-hong-kong-final/ |access-date=7 February 2026 |website=[[World Snooker Tour]] |language=en}}</ref>

| colspan=7 | Following Hammarskjöld's death, the developing world insisted on a non-European and non-American secretary-general; U Thant was nominated but due to opposition from the French (Thant had chaired a committee on [[Algerian nationalism|Algerian independence]]) and the Arabs (Burma supported [[Israel]]), Thant was only appointed for the remainder of Hammarskjöld's term (1 year and 5 months, until 10 April 1963). The following year, on 30 November, Thant was unanimously re-elected and his partial term was promoted to a full 5-year term ending on 3 November 1966. On 2 December 1966, Thant was again unanimously re-elected, and appointed by a General Assembly session to a 5-year-and-2-month term aligned with the calendar year. Thant did not seek a third election.<ref name="una-usa-fact"/> Thant was the first Asian secretary-general.
| colspan=7 | Following Hammarskjöld's death, the developing world insisted on a non-European secretary-general; U Thant was nominated but due to opposition from the French (Thant had chaired a committee on [[Algerian nationalism|Algerian independence]]) and the Arabs (Burma supported [[Israel]]), Thant was only appointed for the remainder of Hammarskjöld's term (1 year and 5 months, until 10 April 1963). The following year, on 30 November, Thant was unanimously re-elected and his partial term was promoted to a full 5-year term ending on 3 November 1966. On 2 December 1966, Thant was again unanimously re-elected, and appointed by a General Assembly session to a 5-year-and-2-month term aligned with the calendar year. Thant did not seek a third election.<ref name="una-usa-fact"/> Thant was the first Asian secretary-general.

'''JKLN''' (born '''Jacqueline Faraui'''; June 26, 1991) is an electronic music producer, composer, singer-songwriter, and multi-instrumentalist based in Berlin. She is known for her chart-topping single ''Welcome to Ukraine'', international electronic music releases, and interdisciplinary work across music, film, and sports-related projects.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

== Biography ==
Faraui was born in Kyiv, Ukraine, and spent part of her childhood in Kherson. Her mother is from Kherson and was a professional dance athlete, while her father, originally from the Middle East, is a conductor and composer. At the age of six, she moved to Greece, where she was raised before relocating to Berlin in 2019.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

She received formal musical training from an early age, including singing lessons, choir participation, classical and jazz piano, music theory, and dance education. She also trained in athletics and later studied audio engineering. In addition to her formal education, she is self-taught on guitar and ukulele.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

In composer and publishing contexts, her first name is transliterated as ''Zhaklin'', a spelling variation used in international credits.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

== Career ==
JKLN gained international recognition with the release of ''Welcome to Ukraine'', which went viral and reached number one on Ukrainian music charts, remaining there for several months. The song also reached number two on global house and dance charts and appeared among daily viral tracks in Ukraine.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

She collaborated with the Saunderson Brothers on the track ''Forever Young'', released via KMS Records in Detroit with support from Kevin Saunderson. Her music has been released through international labels including Ultra Records and Smash Deep, and her compositions have been published through Universal Music Publishing.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

''Welcome to Ukraine'' was featured in the documentary ''Ukraine Under Fire'', expanding her work into film-related contexts.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

In 2026, she wrote a song for the Ukrainian Wrestling Association in collaboration with Olympic wrestler Oksana Livach, marking her involvement in sports-related cinematic music projects.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

She is currently based in Berlin and remains active in electronic and cinematic music production.<ref>[citation needed]</ref>

== Works ==
* ''Welcome to Ukraine''
* ''Forever Young''
* ''Undone''
* Selected releases on Ultra Records and Smash Deep

== International career ==
== International career ==
Khan was selected for the Pakistan national team in 1976, when the team toured Afghanistan at the [[Afghanistan Republic Day Festival Cup]]. The same year, he was selected for the [[1976 Quaid-e-Azam International Tournament]] held in [[Karachi]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=Quaid-E-Azam International Cup (Pakistan) |url=https://www.rsssf.org/tablesq/quaid-e-azam.html#76 |url-status=live |archive-url=http://web.archive.org/web/20240201223845/https://www.rsssf.org/tablesq/quaid-e-azam.html#76 |archive-date=2024-02-01 |access-date=2024-10-19 |website=www.rsssf.org}}</ref> He subsequently played in several matches in [[Bangladesh]], [[Burma]], [[Thailand]], [[Malaysia]], and again competed in the Afghanistan Republic Day Festival Cup in 1977 with the Shaheen FC team. In 1978, he participated in a Youth Tournament in [[Saudi Arabia]].<ref name=":0" /> Khan also played at the next [[1982 Quaid-e-Azam International Tournament]] edition, where he featured in all matches as regular starter.<ref name=":1" />
Khan was selected for the Pakistan national team in 1976, when the team toured Afghanistan at the [[Afghanistan Republic Day Festival Cup]]. The same year, he was selected for the [[1976 Quaid-e-Azam International Tournament]] held in [[Karachi]].<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |title=Quaid-E-Azam International Cup (Pakistan) |url=https://www.rsssf.org/tablesq/quaid-e-azam.html#76 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240201223845/https://www.rsssf.org/tablesq/quaid-e-azam.html#76 |archive-date=2024-02-01 |access-date=2024-10-19 |website=www.rsssf.org}}</ref> He subsequently played in several matches in [[Bangladesh]], [[Burma]], [[Thailand]], [[Malaysia]], and again competed in the Afghanistan Republic Day Festival Cup in 1977 with the Shaheen FC team. In 1978, he participated in a Youth Tournament in [[Saudi Arabia]].<ref name=":0" /> Khan also played at the next [[1982 Quaid-e-Azam International Tournament]] edition, where he featured in all matches as regular starter.<ref name=":1" />


== Coaching career ==
== Coaching career ==
After de facto retirement from the [[PIA F.C.|Pakistan Airlines]] football team in 1992, he became involved in the field of coaching through guidance of [[Tariq Lutfi]]. The same year, he participated in coaching course in [[Lahore]], and later in [[Karachi]] in 1995, until receiving his coaching certificate.<ref name=":0" />

* ... that '''[[1699 May Day orations|five speeches by William & Mary students]]''' helped to move Virginia's capital and establish Williamsburg?
* ... that in 2002, '''[[Sarah Baxendale]]''' broke the Guinness World Record for the longest kiss featured on screen?
* ... that '''[[Althea Hunt]]''' founded the William & Mary Theatre, but discouraged students from trying to make a career of it?
* ... that 16 years ago, '''[[The Man Who Slipped on the Ice|a man in Ireland slipped on some ice]]'''?
* ... that Thomas Jefferson pushed William & Mary to hire '''[[Carlo Bellini|a man with little linguistic ability]]''' as its first professor of modern languages?

source_payload.html:
Better way to handle genres?: Reply

← Previous revision Revision as of 00:00, 8 February 2026
Line 278: Line 278:


:The recommendation at [[WP:FILMGENRE]] is to just list one primary genre, so this shouldn't really be an issue. If there is no clear primary genre and multiple need to be included then that shouldn't be handled in the opening sentence, it should be explained later in the lead and that would probably avoid any SEAOFBLUE problems. - [[User:Adamstom.97|adamstom97]] ([[User talk:Adamstom.97|talk]]) 17:07, 7 February 2026 (UTC)
:The recommendation at [[WP:FILMGENRE]] is to just list one primary genre, so this shouldn't really be an issue. If there is no clear primary genre and multiple need to be included then that shouldn't be handled in the opening sentence, it should be explained later in the lead and that would probably avoid any SEAOFBLUE problems. - [[User:Adamstom.97|adamstom97]] ([[User talk:Adamstom.97|talk]]) 17:07, 7 February 2026 (UTC)
::FILMGENRE also allows for a sub-genre too, which I feel is sometimes necessary. For example, ''Pretty Woman'' is quintessentially a romantic-comedy film, and either "romance" or "comedy" would not be a good fit for it on their own. Maybe the answer is to not link sub-genres unless they have their own article i.e. [[Romantic comedy]] film as opposed to "[[Romance film|Romantic]]-[[comedy drama]] film"? Another option would be to red-link sub-genres without an article (such as "[[Science fiction horror]]") and encourage article creation for established sub-genres. That might have the added benefit of discouraging loading the lead with loads of genres too. [[User:Betty Logan|Betty Logan]] ([[User talk:Betty Logan|talk]]) 00:00, 8 February 2026 (UTC)

The median income for a household in the CDP was $38,696, and the median income for a family was $41,513. Males had a median income of $29,044 versus $21,755 for females. About 10.5% of families and 10.8% of the population were below the [[poverty line]], including 17.3% of those under age 18 and 6.2% of those age 65 or over.

Lesser bulldog bats, or ''Noctilio albiventris,'' frequently live and forage in urban areas, such as buildings and attics, aquaculture ponds, and urban water bodies (Jung and Kalko). Because of this close association with anthropogenic landscapes, human activities can directly influence their behavior and ecology. As urbanization continues to increase on a global scale, it is important to consider how our presence can change ecosystems as a whole to benefit conservation of species and to better coexist with our fellow urban species.
Lesser bulldog bats, or ''Noctilio albiventris,'' frequently live and forage in urban areas, such as buildings and attics, aquaculture ponds, and urban water bodies (Jung and Kalko). Because of this close association with anthropogenic landscapes, human activities can directly influence their behavior and ecology. As urbanization continues to increase on a global scale, it is important to consider how our presence can change ecosystems as a whole to benefit conservation of species and to better coexist with our fellow urban species.


I would propose that this section be at the end of the article, as the previous sections give important context for understanding human impact on ''N. albiventris''.

The '''cheese fly''', '''cheese skipper''', or '''ham skipper''' ('''''Piophila casei''''') is a [[species]] of fly from the family [[Piophilidae]] whose larvae are known to infest cured meats, smoked or salted fish, cheeses and carrion. On the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] island of [[Sardinia]], the larvae are intentionally introduced into [[pecorino sardo]] cheese to produce the characteristic ''[[casu martzu]]''. If consumed by humans, the larvae have a chance to survive in the [[intestine]], causing [[enteric]] [[myiasis]],<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Peckenscneider |first1=L. E. |last2=Polorny |first2=C. |last3=Hellwig |first3=C. A. |date=May 17, 1952 |title=Intestinal infestation with maggots of the cheese fly (Piophila casei) |journal=[[JAMA (journal)|JAMA]] |volume=149 |issue=3 |pages=262–263 |doi=10.1001/jama.1952.72930200005011b |pmid=14927333 }}</ref> though no such cases have been linked to ''casu martzu'' dishes.<ref name=CNNtravel>{{cite web|last=Petroni|first=Agostino|url=https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/casu-marzu-worlds-most-dangerous-cheese/index.html|title=Casu marzu: The world's 'most dangerous' cheese|website=[[CNN Travel]]|date=18 March 2021|access-date=12 March 2025|others=Lead photo by Andrea Serreli}}</ref> The larvae may also carry harmful microorganisms that, when consumed, could cause infections.<ref name="Europarl-2024">{{Cite web |date=2024-01-15 |title=Subject: Petition No 0702/2023 presented by Nicolò Quartararo (Italian) on restoring the status of Casu Marzu cheese as a foodstuff and edible product in the EU |url=https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/PETI-CM-758761_EN.pdf |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240608022912/https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/PETI-CM-758761_EN.pdf |archive-date=2024-06-08 |archive-format=PDF |access-date=2024-06-08 |publisher=[[European Parliament]]}}</ref>
The '''cheese fly''', '''cheese skipper''', or '''ham skipper''' ('''''Piophila casei''''') is a [[species]] of fly from the family [[Piophilidae]] whose larvae are known to infest cured meats, smoked or salted fish, cheeses and [[carrion]]. On the [[Mediterranean Sea|Mediterranean]] island of [[Sardinia]], the larvae are intentionally introduced into [[pecorino sardo]] cheese to produce the characteristic ''[[casu martzu]]''.
If consumed by humans, the larvae have a chance to survive in the [[intestine]], causing [[enteric]] [[myiasis]],<ref>{{cite journal|last1=Peckenscneider |first1=L. E. |last2=Polorny |first2=C. |last3=Hellwig |first3=C. A. |date=May 17, 1952 |title=Intestinal infestation with [[maggots]] of the cheese fly (Piophila casei) |journal=[[JAMA (journal)|JAMA]] |volume=149 |issue=3 |pages=262–263 |doi=10.1001/jama.1952.72930200005011b |pmid=14927333 }}</ref> though no such cases have been linked to ''casu martzu'' dishes.<ref name=CNNtravel>{{cite web|last=Petroni|first=Agostino|url=https://www.cnn.com/travel/article/casu-marzu-worlds-most-dangerous-cheese/index.html|title=Casu marzu: The world's 'most dangerous' cheese|website=[[CNN Travel]]|date=18 March 2021|access-date=12 March 2025|others=Lead photo by Andrea Serreli}}</ref> The larvae may also carry harmful microorganisms that, when consumed, could cause infections.<ref name="Europarl-2024">{{Cite web |date=2024-01-15 |title=Subject: Petition No 0702/2023 presented by Nicolò Quartararo (Italian) on restoring the status of Casu Marzu cheese as a foodstuff and edible product in the EU |url=https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/PETI-CM-758761_EN.pdf |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240608022912/https://www.europarl.europa.eu/doceo/document/PETI-CM-758761_EN.pdf |archive-date=2024-06-08 |archive-format=PDF |access-date=2024-06-08 |publisher=[[European Parliament]]}}</ref>

Fitting, monuments and glass

← Previous revision Revision as of 00:00, 8 February 2026
Line 57: Line 57:
The church contains several monuments dating from the 17th to 19th centuries, including works by Rysbrack and Westmacott, commemorating members of the Eliot family, the Earls of St Germans, and other local figures.<ref name="Historic England" /> Medieval liturgical fittings include a piscina, sedilia, and tomb recesses with ogee hoods, together with a holy-water stoup near the west door. Arches supported on clustered columns connect the nave with both west towers.<ref name="Historic England" /><ref name="Jenkins" />
The church contains several monuments dating from the 17th to 19th centuries, including works by Rysbrack and Westmacott, commemorating members of the Eliot family, the Earls of St Germans, and other local figures.<ref name="Historic England" /> Medieval liturgical fittings include a piscina, sedilia, and tomb recesses with ogee hoods, together with a holy-water stoup near the west door. Arches supported on clustered columns connect the nave with both west towers.<ref name="Historic England" /><ref name="Jenkins" />


The chancel east window contains stained glass of 1896 by [[Morris & Co.|Morris and Co.]] to designs by [[Edward Burne-Jones]], depicting Christ and attendant figures above [[Saint Stephen|St Stephen]] and the [[Four Evangelists]]. Burne-Jones also designed the south-wall windows of 1902, representing the Virtues.<ref name="auto1">{{Cite web|url= https://www.visitstainedglass.uk/location/church-of-st-germanus-st-germans-cornwall |title=Church of St Germanus, St Germans, Cornwall |website=Visit Stained Glass}}</ref><ref name="Jenkins" />
The chancel east window contains stained glass of 1896 by [[Morris & Co.|Morris and Co.]] to designs by [[Edward Burne-Jones]], depicting Christ and attendant figures above [[Saint Stephen|St Stephen]] and the [[Four Evangelists]]. Burne-Jones also designed the south-wall windows of 1902, representing the Virtues.<ref name="Jenkins" /> <ref name="auto1">{{Cite web|url= https://www.visitstainedglass.uk/location/church-of-st-germanus-st-germans-cornwall |title=Church of St Germanus, St Germans, Cornwall |website=Visit Stained Glass}}</ref>


Memorials in the south aisle and elsewhere commemorate the Eliot family, who acquired the former priory after the Dissolution. Among the most notable is the monument to Edward Eliot (1682–1722) in the north-west part of the church, an early English work in black and white marble by the Flemish sculptor [[John Michael Rysbrack]], commissioned in 1723. Eliot served as Tory Member of Parliament for the rotten borough of St Germans between 1705 and 1710.<ref name="Jenkins" /> <ref name="listed">{{English Heritage List entry |num= 1140544 |desc= Church of St Germanus|grade= |access-date=16 December 2024}}</ref>
Memorials in the south aisle and elsewhere commemorate the Eliot family, who acquired the former priory after the Dissolution. Among the most notable is the monument to Edward Eliot (1682–1722) in the north-west part of the church, an early English work in black and white marble by the Flemish sculptor [[John Michael Rysbrack]], commissioned in 1723. Eliot served as Tory Member of Parliament for the rotten borough of St Germans between 1705 and 1710.<ref name="Jenkins" /><ref name="listed">{{English Heritage List entry |num= 1140544 |desc= Church of St Germanus|grade= |access-date=16 December 2024}}</ref>


The church also contains a mortuary chapel of the Moyle family of [[Bake, Cornwall|Bake]].<ref>[http://www.british-history.ac.uk/report.aspx?compid=51805 British History.ac.uk website. Retrieved March 2010.]</ref>
